page.title: 03VEGETATION SCOUT DYKE & PETS
page.content: Many ancient pastures which have never been ploughed, and these show a variety of wild plants. {SCOUT DYKE _ Outdoor pursuits centre is run by Barnsley Education Authority. Barnsley schools bring parties of children for up to a week for environmental studies and outdoor activities. The centre was started in 1935 and provided the only holiday that many Barnsley children had in those days, although the policity of the Education Committee was that it should be a school camp and not a holiday camp. A big improve_ ment in the childrens' health was noticed after a week at camp. {PETS }_ Survey in school _ rabbits 23, cats 40, dogs 55, horses and ponies 22, donkeys 1, ducks 21, fish 94, hens 63, gerbils 4, budgie's 7, guinea pigs 9, goats 4, mice 1, lambs 1, terrapins 1, hamsters 1, geese 2, pigeons 30.
